intro: Helosciadium nodiflorum var. longipedunculatum, commonly known as the long pedunculate helosciadium, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It features slender, elongated peduncles that bear clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, spicy scent. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
